section.title: Contents
section.para: This guide contains information pertaining to managing WVU ACM and FSG student organizations. Everything you need to do as part of your job as a club officer should be documented here. If you come across something that is not documented, then document it. If you come across a piece of information that is incorrect in this document, then correct it!

section.title: DocBook
section.para: This guide is rendered into HTML and PDF formats from a collection of well-formatted XML documents. The XML source complies to the DocBook V5.1 (or newer) schema.

Eric S. Raymond writes about DocBook (and the reasons you should use it) in his book, The Art of Unix Programming. In summary: DocBook lets you spend less time fiddling with what your document looks like (bold, indented, numbered or bulleted lists?), and spend more time on what your book says. When writing DocBook you describe the contents of your document. Then, when you're finished, a toolset transforms the XML sources and produces uniformly styled HTML and PDF documents. The presentation-level work is all done for you.
To learn more about DocBook visit its website: docbook.org.
